Few creatures can shrug off an [ankhrav's](/Monsters.aspx?ID=23) acid and crunch its chitin like a khravgodon. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 26 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 [Khravgodon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1254) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 192 **Perception** +18; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 30 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +21, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +18, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +18 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +5 **Int** -4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +20 **Ref** +18 **Will** +16 +2 circumstance to all saves vs. [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) **HP** 160 **Resistances** acid 10, [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) 10 **Feign Death** **Trigger** The opossum is reduced below 70 HP; **Effect** The opossum collapses. It is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful DC 18 Perception check to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) or [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) check to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.
**Revived Retaliation** **Trigger** The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death; **Effect** The opossum Strikes the triggering creature. --- **Speed** 30 feet, burrow 15 feet, climb 15 feet **Melee** jaws +21 ([deadly d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174)), **Damage** 2d12+9 piercing **Melee** claw +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d10+9 slashing **Melee** tail +21 ([reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+9 bludgeoning plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Crush Chitin** **Requirements** The khravgodon has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33); **Effect** The khravgodon bites the creature, dealing 2d12+9 piercing damage (DC 28 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) that ignores the first 5 of the target's Hardness or resistance to physical damage. On a failed save, the target also takes a –2 circumstance penalty to AC for 1 round. **Grasping Tail** A khravgodon can drag a Large or smaller creature it has [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) with its tail along with it when it Strides.
Tail Tales A Kellid legend holds that the khravgodon once had a beautiful tail covered with bright, thick fur. One night, the khravgodon fell asleep in the open, having danced all night showing off its beautiful tail. When it awoke, [ankhravs](/Monsters.aspx?ID=23) had chewed all the hair off khravgodon's tail, leaving it with the bald appendage we see today. Khravgodons have been taking revenge on ankhravs ever since.
